what: Execute joins between datasets based on a connection path — execute_dataset_joins
title: Execute joins between datasets based on a connection path — execute_dataset_joins
text: function performs joins datasets following optimal path determined find_optimal_path(), using relations defined YAML.

title: Execute joins between datasets based on a connection path — execute_dataset_joins
code: execute_dataset_joins(   tibbles,   path_info,   relations,   verbose = TRUE,   reference_date = NULL,   start_dataset = NULL )

title: Execute joins between datasets based on a connection path — execute_dataset_joins
text: tibbles List tibbles join path_info Path information returned find_optimal_path() relations List relation definitions YAML configuration verbose Logical indicating whether display progress messages reference_date Optional date filter records start_dataset Optional name dataset start . Default NULL, use first dataset first connection.

title: Execute joins between datasets based on a connection path — execute_dataset_joins
text: joined tibble

what: Find the optimal path to connect datasets — find_optimal_path
title: Find the optimal path to connect datasets — find_optimal_path
text: function finds optimal path connect multiple datasets based predefined relations. uses graph theory determine best possible connections datasets.

title: Find the optimal path to connect datasets — find_optimal_path
code: find_optimal_path(   dataset_names,   relations,   verbose = TRUE,   start_with_first = TRUE )

title: Find the optimal path to connect datasets — find_optimal_path
text: dataset_names Character vector names datasets connect relations List relation definitions verbose Logical indicating whether display progress messages start_with_first Logical indicating whether force starting first dataset. Default TRUE.

title: Find the optimal path to connect datasets — find_optimal_path
text: list path information, including: path: sequence datasets visit connections: Details connection path

what: Add metadata to a dataset — rio_add_dataset_metadata
title: Add metadata to a dataset — rio_add_dataset_metadata
text: function adds metadata dataset RIO structure.

title: Add metadata to a dataset — rio_add_dataset_metadata
code: rio_add_dataset_metadata(   datasets,   dataset_name,   category = NULL,   subcategory = NULL,   dimension = NULL,   description = NULL,   extra_metadata = NULL )

title: Add metadata to a dataset — rio_add_dataset_metadata
text: datasets RIO datasets structure returned rio_load_datasets(). dataset_name Name dataset. category Main category dataset (e.g., "Educational Structure Reality"). subcategory Subcategory dataset (e.g., ""). dimension Dimension dataset (e.g., "Primary Education"). description Description dataset. NULL, existing description kept. extra_metadata List additional metadata.

title: Add metadata to a dataset — rio_add_dataset_metadata
text: updated RIO datasets structure.

what: Execute an API call to the RIO CKAN API — rio_api_call
title: Execute an API call to the RIO CKAN API — rio_api_call
text: function executes prepared request RIO CKAN API returns parsed JSON response.

code: rio_api_call(endpoint, method = "GET", body = NULL, simplify = TRUE)

title: Execute an API call to the RIO CKAN API — rio_api_call
text: endpoint API endpoint call. method HTTP method use. Default "GET". body request body list POST requests. Default NULL. simplify Whether simplify response R vectors/matrices. Default TRUE. req request object, typically created rio_api_connection(). NULL, new connection created.

title: Execute an API call to the RIO CKAN API — rio_api_call
text: parsed JSON response API.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ response <- rio_api_call(endpoint = "group_list") } # }

text: base_url base URL RIO CKAN API. Default "https://onderwijsdata.duo.nl/api/3/action".

title: Create a connection to the RIO CKAN API — rio_api_connection
text: request object configured RIO CKAN API.

what: Detect available datasets and their fields — rio_detect_datasets
title: Detect available datasets and their fields — rio_detect_datasets
text: function retrieves available RIO datasets fields stores information later use. Unlike rio_detect_structure(), relationships datasets detected.

title: Detect available datasets and their fields — rio_detect_datasets
code: rio_detect_datasets(   force = FALSE,   days_threshold = 28,   save_dir = get_rio_data_dir(),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Detect available datasets and their fields — rio_detect_datasets
text: force Logical indicating whether perform new detection, even recent dataset detection exists. Default FALSE. days_threshold Number days dataset detection considered outdated. Default 28 (4 weeks). save_dir Directory result saved. Default data directory package. quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages. Default FALSE.

title: Detect available datasets and their fields — rio_detect_datasets
text: Returns list detected RIO datasets (invisible).

what: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
title: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
text: function exports default relation definitions package user-specific location customization. allows users modify RIO relation definitions without changing package files.

title: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
code: rio_export_default_relations(   overwrite = FALSE,   destination = NULL,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
text: overwrite Logical value indicating whether overwrite existing files. Default FALSE safety. destination Path save file. Default NULL, use standard user data directory returned get_rio_data_dir(). quiet Logical value indicating whether suppress informational messages. Default FALSE.

title: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
text: Path exported file (invisibly).

title: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
text: function copies default relations YAML file package user's data directory, allowing customization without modifying package . exported, user can edit YAML file add, modify, remove relations. default, rio_load_relations() function automatically detect use user-specific version exists, providing seamless way override default relations.

title: Export default relation definitions to a user-specific version — rio_export_default_relations
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Export default relations for customization rio_export_default_relations()  # Export and overwrite existing user definitions rio_export_default_relations(overwrite = TRUE)  # Export to a specific location rio_export_default_relations(destination = "~/my_project/rio_relations.yaml") } # }

what: Filter data based on a reference date — rio_filter_by_reference_date
title: Filter data based on a reference date — rio_filter_by_reference_date
text: function filters temporal data based reference date, keeping records valid specified date. prioritizes EINDDATUM/BEGINDATUM EINDDATUM_PERIODE/BEGINDATUM_PERIODE.

title: Filter data based on a reference date — rio_filter_by_reference_date
code: rio_filter_by_reference_date(   data,   reference_date,   start_date_col = NULL,   end_date_col = NULL )

title: Filter data based on a reference date — rio_filter_by_reference_date
text: data tibble containing temporal data date columns. reference_date date records valid (Date object). start_date_col name column containing start dates. Default NULL, means function automatically search appropriate columns. end_date_col name column containing end dates. Default NULL, means function automatically search appropriate columns.

title: Filter data based on a reference date — rio_filter_by_reference_date
text: filtered tibble containing records valid reference date, original tibble suitable date columns found.

what: Find connections between RIO datasets based on predefined relations — rio_find_connections
title: Find connections between RIO datasets based on predefined relations — rio_find_connections
text: function identifies connections RIO datasets using relations defined YAML configuration file.

title: Find connections between RIO datasets based on predefined relations — rio_find_connections
code: rio_find_connections(   dataset_names,   relations,   min_confidence = "medium",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Find connections between RIO datasets based on predefined relations — rio_find_connections
text: dataset_names Character vector names datasets find connections relations List relation definitions YAML configuration min_confidence Minimum confidence level relationships ("high" "medium") verbose Logical indicating whether display progress messages. Default FALSE.

title: Find connections between RIO datasets based on predefined relations — rio_find_connections
text: list connections specified datasets

what: Find paths between tables based on predefined relations — rio_find_table_paths
title: Find paths between tables based on predefined relations — rio_find_table_paths
text: helper function identifies paths tables using relations defined YAML configuration. used rio_visualize() rio_join() ensure consistent behavior.

title: Find paths between tables based on predefined relations — rio_find_table_paths
code: rio_find_table_paths(   tables,   relations,   min_confidence = "medium",   find_paths = TRUE,   max_path_length = NULL,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Find paths between tables based on predefined relations — rio_find_table_paths
text: tables Character vector table names find paths relations List relation definitions min_confidence Minimum confidence level relationships ("high" "medium") find_paths Logical indicating whether look indirect paths tables max_path_length Maximum path length consider find_paths TRUE. Default NULL (limit). quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages

title: Find paths between tables based on predefined relations — rio_find_table_paths
text: list containing: tables: Character vector tables include (original + intermediate) paths: List connection paths tables

what: Fetch data from a RIO table with date filtering — rio_get_data
title: Fetch data from a RIO table with date filtering — rio_get_data
text: function retrieves data RIO table, optionally filtering reference date get records valid date.

title: Fetch data from a RIO table with date filtering — rio_get_data
code: rio_get_data(   table_id = NULL,   table_name = NULL,   reference_date = NULL,   limit = NULL,   query = NULL,   all_records = TRUE,   batch_size = 1000,   quiet = FALSE,   ... )

title: Fetch data from a RIO table with date filtering — rio_get_data
text: table_id ID table resource retrieve. Default NULL. table_name name table resource retrieve. Default NULL. Either table_id table_name must provided. reference_date Optional date filter valid records. provided, records valid date returned. Default NULL (date filtering). limit Maximum number records return. Default NULL (records). query search query string full-text search. Default NULL. all_records Logical indicating whether fetch records. Default TRUE. batch_size Number records retrieve per API call. Default 1000. quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages. Default FALSE. ... Additional named parameters used filters.

title: Fetch data from a RIO table with date filtering — rio_get_data
text: tibble containing retrieved data.

title: Fetch data from a RIO table with date filtering — rio_get_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get data from a table by name locaties <- rio_get_data(table_name = "onderwijslocaties")  # Get data from a table by ID with a reference date vestigingen <- rio_get_data(table_id = "vestigingserkenningen-id",                            reference_date = as.Date("2023-01-01"))  # Get data with a filter rotterdam <- rio_get_data(table_name = "onderwijslocaties",                          PLAATSNAAM = "Rotterdam") } # }

title: Get metadata of a dataset — rio_get_dataset_metadata

title: Get metadata of a dataset — rio_get_dataset_metadata
code: rio_get_dataset_metadata(datasets, dataset_name)

title: Get metadata of a dataset — rio_get_dataset_metadata
text: datasets RIO datasets structure returned rio_load_datasets(). dataset_name Name dataset.

title: Get metadata of a dataset — rio_get_dataset_metadata
text: list metadata dataset.

what: Get information about fields in a dataset — rio_get_fields
title: Get information about fields in a dataset — rio_get_fields
text: function retrieves information available fields (columns) dataset, can used filtering rio_get_data function.

title: Get information about fields in a dataset — rio_get_fields
code: rio_get_fields(dataset_id = NULL, dataset_name = NULL)

title: Get information about fields in a dataset — rio_get_fields
text: dataset_id ID dataset resource. Default NULL. dataset_name name dataset resource. Default NULL. Either dataset_id dataset_name must provided.

title: Get information about fields in a dataset — rio_get_fields
text: tibble information fields dataset.

title: Get information about fields in a dataset — rio_get_fields
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get fields for the "Onderwijslocaties" dataset fields <- rio_get_fields(dataset_name = "Onderwijslocaties")  # Print the field names that can be used for filtering print(fields$id) } # }

title: Get educational locations — rio_get_locations
text: function retrieves educational locations RIO API. convenient wrapper around rio_get_data "Onderwijslocaties" dataset. default, returns simple tibble, can also convert data sf object spatial analysis mapping.

title: Get educational locations — rio_get_locations
code: rio_get_locations(   city = NULL,   limit = NULL,   as_sf = FALSE,   remove_invalid = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   ... )

title: Get educational locations — rio_get_locations
text: city Optional city name(s) filter locations. Default NULL. limit Maximum number records return. Default NULL. as_sf Logical indicating whether return result sf object. Default FALSE. remove_invalid Logical indicating whether remove rows invalid missing coordinates. Default FALSE quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages. Default FALSE. ... Additional filter parameters pass rio_get_data.

title: Get educational locations — rio_get_locations
text: tibble containing educational location data, sf object as_sf = TRUE.

title: Get educational locations — rio_get_locations
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get educational locations in Rotterdam as a tibble locations <- rio_get_locations(city = "Rotterdam")  # Get educational locations in Rotterdam as an sf object locations_sf <- rio_get_locations(city = "Rotterdam", as_sf = TRUE)  # Plot locations on a map if (requireNamespace("leaflet", quietly = TRUE)) {   leaflet::leaflet(locations_sf) |>     leaflet::addTiles() |>     leaflet::addCircleMarkers() } } # }

code: rio_get_metadata()

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ rio_metadata <- rio_get_metadata() } # }

what: Get detailed information about a specific dataset — rio_get_resource_info
title: Get detailed information about a specific dataset — rio_get_resource_info
text: function retrieves detailed information specific dataset (resource) RIO package.

title: Get detailed information about a specific dataset — rio_get_resource_info
code: rio_get_resource_info(dataset_id = NULL, dataset_name = NULL)

title: Get detailed information about a specific dataset — rio_get_resource_info
text: dataset_id ID resource retrieve. Default NULL. dataset_name name dataset resource retrieve. Default NULL. Either dataset_id dataset_name must provided.

title: Get detailed information about a specific dataset — rio_get_resource_info
text: list containing detailed information dataset.

what: Join RIO tables based on predefined relations — rio_join
title: Join RIO tables based on predefined relations — rio_join
text: function joins multiple RIO tables based relations defined package. automatically detects relations tables chooses optimal join path. GPS coordinates available, result can converted sf object.

title: Join RIO tables based on predefined relations — rio_join
code: rio_join(   ...,   by_names = TRUE,   reference_date = Sys.Date(),   nested = FALSE,   find_paths = TRUE,   max_path_length = 10,   as_sf = FALSE,   remove_invalid = FALSE,   filters = NULL,   query = NULL,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Join RIO tables based on predefined relations — rio_join
text: ... Character vector table names load named tibbles join. by_names Logical indicating whether arguments table names rather actual datasets. Default TRUE. reference_date Optional date filter valid records. Default current date (Sys.Date()). Set NULL disable date filtering. nested Logical indicating whether return nested tibble. Default FALSE. find_paths Logical indicating whether find indirect connection paths datasets directly connected. Default TRUE. max_path_length Maximum length connection paths consider find_paths TRUE. Default 10. as_sf Logical indicating whether convert result sf object GPS coordinates available. Default FALSE. remove_invalid Logical indicating whether remove rows invalid missing coordinates converting sf. Default FALSE. filters Optional named list filters apply loading data. Filters applied tables filter column exists. query Optional search query string full-text search. Default NULL. quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages. Default FALSE.

title: Join RIO tables based on predefined relations — rio_join
text: joined tibble, sf object as_sf = TRUE GPS coordinates available.

title: Join RIO tables based on predefined relations — rio_join
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Join tables by name (default method) joined_data <- rio_join("vestigingserkenningen", "onderwijslocaties")  # Return as sf object for mapping geo_data <- rio_join("vestigingserkenningen", "onderwijslocaties", as_sf = TRUE)  # Join with a specific reference date joined_data <- rio_join("vestigingserkenningen", "onderwijslocaties",                         reference_date = as.Date("2023-01-01"))  # Join with filters on the data joined_data <- rio_join("vestigingserkenningen", "onderwijslocaties",                         filters = list(PLAATSNAAM = "Utrecht"))  # Return a nested tibble nested_data <- rio_join("vestigingserkenningen", "onderwijslocaties", nested = TRUE) } # }

what: List fields in a RIO table — rio_list_fields
title: List fields in a RIO table — rio_list_fields
text: function lists fields (columns) available specified RIO table.

title: List fields in a RIO table — rio_list_fields
code: rio_list_fields(   table_name,   table_id = NULL,   include_info = TRUE,   pattern = NULL )

title: List fields in a RIO table — rio_list_fields
text: table_name name table retrieve fields . table_id ID table. NULL, table_name used look ID. include_info Logical indicating whether include field type information. Default TRUE. pattern Optional pattern filter field names. Default NULL (filtering).

title: List fields in a RIO table — rio_list_fields
text: tibble information field.

title: List fields in a RIO table — rio_list_fields
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all fields in the onderwijslocaties table fields <- rio_list_fields("onderwijslocaties")  # Filter fields containing "datum" date_fields <- rio_list_fields("onderwijslocaties", pattern = "datum") } # }

text: Optional filter show relationships specific table. Optional filter show relationships specific table. pattern Optional pattern filter relationship descriptions. include_metadata Logical indicating whether include relationship metadata. Default FALSE.

text: dataframe relationship information.

title: List relationships between RIO tables — rio_list_relations
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all table relationships all_relations <- rio_list_relations()  # Filter relationships from the "onderwijslocaties" table loc_relations <- rio_list_relations(from = "onderwijslocaties")  # Filter relationships between two specific tables specific_relations <- rio_list_relations(   from = "onderwijslocaties",   to = "vestigingserkenningen" ) } # }

title: Visualize relationships between RIO tables — rio_visualize_relations
text: ... Character vector table names visualize. by_names Logical indicating whether arguments table names rather actual tibbles. Default TRUE. highlight_tables Character vector table names highlight visualization. min_confidence Minimum confidence level relationships. Can "high" "medium". Default "medium". interactive Logical indicating whether create interactive visualization (requires visNetwork package). Default TRUE. as_table Logical indicating whether return relations table. Default FALSE. find_paths Logical indicating whether find connection paths tables directly connected. Default TRUE. max_path_length Maximum length connection paths consider find_paths TRUE. Default NULL (limit). quiet Logical indicating whether suppress progress messages. Default FALSE.

title: Visualize relationships between RIO tables — rio_visualize_relations
text: visualization object showing relationships tables.

title: Visualize relationships between RIO tables — rio_visualize_relations
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Visualize the relationship between two specific tables rio_visualize("onderwijslocaties", "vestigingserkenningen")  # Visualize all relationships (no arguments) rio_visualize()  # Highlight specific tables rio_visualize("onderwijslocaties", "vestigingserkenningen",              highlight_tables = "onderwijslocaties") } # }

what: Visualize relationships between RIO datasets — rio_visualize_structure
title: Visualize relationships between RIO datasets — rio_visualize_structure
text: function creates visualization relationships RIO datasets based YAML-defined structure. can show connections specific datasets, including indirect connections intermediary datasets.

title: Visualize relationships between RIO datasets — rio_visualize_structure
code: rio_visualize_structure(   datasets = NULL,   relations = NULL,   min_confidence = "medium",   interactive = TRUE,   highlight_datasets = NULL,   find_paths = TRUE,   max_path_length = 3,   ... )

title: Visualize relationships between RIO datasets — rio_visualize_structure
text: datasets Optional character vector dataset names visualize. NULL, datasets structure visualized. relations Optional relation definitions. NULL, relations loaded YAML file. min_confidence Minimum confidence level relationships. Can "high" "medium". Default "medium". interactive Logical indicating whether create interactive visualization (requires visNetwork package). Default TRUE. highlight_datasets Character vector dataset names highlight visualization. find_paths Logical indicating whether find connection paths datasets directly connected. Default TRUE. max_path_length Maximum length connection paths consider find_paths TRUE. Default 3. ... Optional named tibbles visualize connections (alternative method).

title: Visualize relationships between RIO datasets — rio_visualize_structure
text: visualization object showing relationships datasets.

what: Plot timeline of institutions or entities — rio_visualize_timeline
title: Plot timeline of institutions or entities — rio_visualize_timeline
text: function creates timeline plot showing validity periods institutions entities.

title: Plot timeline of institutions or entities — rio_visualize_timeline
code: rio_visualize_timeline(   data,   id_col,   name_col = NULL,   start_date_col = "BEGINDATUM",   end_date_col = "EINDDATUM" )

title: Plot timeline of institutions or entities — rio_visualize_timeline
text: data tibble containing data start end dates. id_col name column containing entity IDs. name_col name column containing entity names. Default NULL. start_date_col name column containing start dates. Default "BEGINDATUM". end_date_col name column containing end dates. Default "EINDDATUM".

title: Plot timeline of institutions or entities — rio_visualize_timeline
text: ggplot object showing timeline.

title: Plot timeline of institutions or entities — rio_visualize_timeline
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ institutions <- rio_get_data(dataset_id = "institution-resource-id") plot <- rio_timeline(   institutions,   id_col = "INSTELLINGSCODE",   name_col = "INSTELLINGSNAAM" ) } # }

what: Visualize the connection path between datasets — visualize_path
title: Visualize the connection path between datasets — visualize_path
text: function creates visualization datasets connected based optimal path determined find_optimal_path().

title: Visualize the connection path between datasets — visualize_path
code: visualize_path(path_info, relations, dataset_names, interactive = TRUE)

title: Visualize the connection path between datasets — visualize_path
text: path_info Path information returned find_optimal_path() relations List relation definitions dataset_names Character vector names datasets visualize interactive Logical indicating whether create interactive visualization

title: Visualize the connection path between datasets — visualize_path
text: visualization object (igraph plot visNetwork object)
